text: Barughutu is a census town in Mandu (community development block) of Ramgarh district in the state of Jharkhand, India. Barughutu is adjacent to Ghatotand, where Tata Steel's West Bokaro Colliery is situated. ==Demographics== As per 2011 Census of India Barughutu had a population of 24,202. There were 12,864 males and 11,338 females. Scheduled Castes numbered 3,721 and Scheduled Tribes numbered 1,930. India census, Barughutu had a population of 21,091. Males constitute 54% of the population and females 46%. Barughutu has an average literacy rate of 70%, higher than the national average of 59.5%; with 59% of the males and 41% of females literate. 16% of the population is under 6 years of age. ==Literacy== As per 2011 census the total number of literates in Barughutu was 18,166 out of which 10,372 were males and 7,794 were females, ==Education== Tata DAV Public School is located at Barughutu. ==References== Category:Cities and towns in Ramgarh district
title: Barughutu
